page.title: 13BUILDINGS IN WARWICK BRIDGE
page.content: {DOWN-A-GATE COMMUNITY CENTRE}was built in the Silver Jubilee year of Queen Elizabeth II (1977).The first stone was laid by Mrs A Elwes who lives in Warwick Hall.Lots of things go on like Brownies,discos,play school etc.At the moment the volunteers who run it are trying to raise money to replace the roof which leaks. { {THE MILL found on the A69 was built in the 1830s it is known to have the largest wheel (in diameter)in the north of England.It is used for grinding barley for use in pig food. {THE CUMBERLAND MILL}was a woollen mill but is now used by several small businesses. It is surounded by super little workers cottages. {WATSON TAYLOR,}a retired joiner, lives in a very old house but theres no more room to tell you about it.
